question: who was the head of the spanish inquisition
vanilla_rag_result: The head of the Spanish Inquisition was the Grand Inquisitor. Throughout its history, there were several individuals who held this title, with the most famous being Tomás de Torquemada, who served as Grand Inquisitor from 1483 until his death in 1498. Other notable Grand Inquisitors mentioned in the passages include those appointed in the 18th and 19th centuries, such as the unnamed bishop who became Grand Inquisitor in 1818 and served until its abolition in 1820.
